annotation.TEXT: Okay...I can believe that Proto Man can somehow slice through a 100 HP barrier and kill a Scuttle virus at the same time. Guts Man doing it, though? And killing two at the same time, no less? Now you're just being silly, game.

The Scuttle viruses are the main enemy type you'll find here. Each one has an elemental affinity and aura (with the exception of the white ones, which are neutral). Much like the Aura Head enemies, you can only get rid of their barriers by hitting them with something that does 100 or more damage (or by using the element they're weak to).

Much like the Scuttle viruses, the Life Virus R has its own 100 HP barrier. The aura also happens to regenerate over time, but it isn't nearly as quick as Bass' aura. You can easily bypass it with things like Hammer, Tree Bomb, or M-Cannon. The Life Virus itself actually doesn't have that much health, but its elemental attacks are a pain to avoid (on top of dealing high damage as well).
Though with its outer shell destroyed, the Life Virus reveals its true form. The very core of its being is...

...A baby Xenomorph holding a disco ball? Whatever the hell this thing is, it's the final opponent of the game, and it's a complete pushover. Sure, the acid it drops deals an absurd amount of damage, but you'd really have to go out of your way to get hit by it. Beyond that, this thing has incredibly low HP (to the point where you can easily kill it with a few charged buster shots).

The Firewall mini-boss has the potential to be a tough fight, if mainly due to its turrets. They fire lasers and missiles at a very quick rate, so taking them out first is the primary objective of this fight. The easiest way to do so is to use Color Man's Navi chip while close to them. The bouncing ball not only deals a lot of damage, but can also hit them multiple times at the right angle (and will generally take both down in 2 or so uses). As a side-note: Don't bother trying to use Bass for this fight. While his full-screen attack seems like it could take this thing down in a few seconds, the explosions it produces don't even reach the boss half the time.

Well, this is it: The only thing left to do in this game is to go through the Undernet and take on the final boss. Surprisingly enough, the last area itself is relatively short. It does have a unique (and very strong) enemy type, but a majority of your time in this place will probably be spent fighting bosses and watching cutscenes (if you don't just skip through them, that is).

As a side-note: The reason I equipped the Heat Armor here was in preparation for one of the Life Virus' attacks. It has several elemental moves it can throw out, the most dangerous of which being its heat wave attack. Naturally however...it never actually used this move when I went up against it (and decided to spam its lightning attack just to rub it in).

For those of you that stuck around this long (for whatever reason), let me say this right now: Don't hold your breath in regards to that message. For my next playthrough, I'll be revisiting a particular game that I initially quit...though recently, has gotten quite the update - one which I feel warrants it a second chance.

It's also worth noting that these viruses can drop the Life Aura series of chips. Life Aura 1 is dropped by the elemental Scuttles, while versions 2 and 3 are dropped by the white/neutral Scuttle (good luck actually getting them to drop - and even then, they're not really worth using so late into the game).
